value.title: How do you even use VertiPaq Analyzer with Power BI???
value.excerpt: Not sure how to use VertiPaq Analyzer with Power BI to optimize your data model? Marco Russo joins Patrick to show you how!  Connect with Marco: https://twitter.com/marcorus Download VertiPaq Analyzer: https://www.sqlbi.com/tools/vertipaq-analyzer/  Guy in a Cube courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses

value.title: How to use the Power BI Aggregations Feature
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam sits down with Christian Wade to discuss how to use the Power BI Aggregations feature. This video will show you the clicks to get to the clicky clicky draggy droppy awesomeness when working with big data, or even massive data.   Christian Wade on Twitter - @_christianWade  LET'S CONNECT!

value.title: INSANE AMAZING updates for the Power BI Embedded Playground (2021)
value.excerpt: Want to try things out with Power BI Embedded? Want to explore the JavaScript API? Try embedding with your own report? Then you need to check out the INSANE AMAZING updates for the Power BI Embedded Playground! Amit Shuster walks us through the revamp.  Blog Announcement: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/announcing-the-new-power-bi-embedded-analytics-playground-preview/

value.title: Introducing Power BI Premium Per User (Preview)
value.excerpt: Are you curious what Power BI Premium Per User is all about? Adam walks you through how to get it and what it means from a user experience. Take advantage of Power BI Premium features without the Premium capacity price!  Announcement Blog: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/power-bi-premium-per-user-public-preview-now-available/

value.title: Link from a Power BI Paginated report to a Power BI report

value.title: Mark as Date Table in Power BI Desktop is here!
value.excerpt: Mark as Date Table in Power BI Desktop is finally here! In this video, Patrick takes what Adam did with a custom date table and shows you how you can use Mark as Date Table in Power BI Desktop. This feature was introduced in the February 2018 release of Power BI Desktop. Mark as Date Table has been available

value.title: Power BI Desktop And Role-Playing Dimensions: Can you do it?
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick talks about Power BI Desktop and role-playing dimensions. Can you even do this in Power BI Desktop? Patrick shows you why one particular way is not recommended as it will cause trouble. And then show you how you can use DAX within Power BI Desktop to take this to the next level.

value.title: Power BI For Report Consumers
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at Power BI for report consumers. Those folks that maybe don't author reports, but just view reports within Power BI. We introduce some basic Power BI concepts and introduce you to areas of the Power BI service to get you familiar with the portal.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Data source, Dataset and parameters

Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: How to Sign up
value.excerpt: Do you want to get started using Power BI? After getting Power BI Desktop, you will want to sign up for the Power BI service. In this video, we show you how to do just that! The process is pretty straightforward using your corporate email address. We do call out one gotcha in the even that your admins

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: Sort By A Measure Not Shown In Visual
value.excerpt: In this Power BI tutorial, Patrick shows you how you can sort by a measure not show in a visual within Power BI Desktop. This was something we didn't even know about until recently and it a great little Power BI nugget. If you wanted to sort by something not shown in a visual, this video is for you!

value.title: Preventing Data Silos with Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick and Kalyn look at data silos and how to prevent it using Power BI. value.excerpt: We had some recent changes to Row-level security in Power BI. Row-level security (RLS) was moved to be configured in Power BI Desktop with the June 2016 release. value.title: Setting default values using COALESCE in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how to get default values using the DAX COALESCE function instead of IF statements. A great way to avoid BLANK in Power BI! value.title: STOP refreshing a single table at a time! (Power BI Desktop)

value.title: Using DAX to format a list of values in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Alberto Ferrari joins Patrick to walk through how you can use DAX to format a list of values within Power BI Desktop. This takes the concatenate values quick measure to the next level.  Original Quick Measure video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SjSKCZtiNlI  Alberto's article - https://www.sqlbi.com/blog/alberto/2018/12/20/displaying-a-list-of-selected-months/
